snippet: President Ashraf Ghani canceled his government’s partnership with Khalilullah Frozi, who was supposed to be in prison for defrauding Kabul Bank.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani, responding to public pressure, cancels government partnership with Khalilullah Frozi, former chief executive of Kabul Bank, who is serving at least 10 years in prison for bank fraud; Frozi had signed agreement allowing him to participate in development project in central Kabul, working during day and serving out his prison sentence each night.
lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani canceled his government’s partnership with Khalilullah Frozi, who was supposed to be in prison for defrauding Kabul Bank.

headline.main: Afghan President Calls Off Business Deal With Banker Convicted of Fraud
headline.print_headline: Afghans Halt Business Deal With Banker Sent to Prison
